name: CDN Enabler
description: Replaces local asset paths with a custom CDN URL for optimized content delivery. Supports images, CSS, JavaScript, fonts, and feeds. Configure which asset types to serve from your CDN including images from /media/, stylesheets and scripts from /assets/ and /themes/, web fonts (WOFF, WOFF2, TTF), and optionally RSS/JSON feeds and sitemaps. Preserves protocols and handles responsive srcset attributes automatically.
author: https://convertvkp.com

config.name: cdnUrl
config.label: Enter URL
config.note: Enter your full CDN URL without a trailing slash (e.g., https://cdn.yourdomain.com). The plugin will automatically handle the protocol (http/https).

config.name: separatorAssets
config.label: Asset Types
config.note: Choose which types of static assets should be served from your CDN.

config.name: enableImages
config.label: Images
config.note: Enable to serve images (.jpg, .png, .gif, .svg, .webp, etc.) from the CDN. This includes images in posts, thumbnails, and responsive `srcset` images.

config.name: enableCss
config.label: CSS
config.note: Enable to serve CSS stylesheets from the CDN.

config.name: enableJs
config.label: JavaScript
config.note: Enable to serve JavaScript files from the CDN.

config.name: enableFonts
config.label: Fonts
config.note: Enable to serve font files (.woff, .woff2, .ttf, etc.) from the CDN.

config.name: separatorFeeds
config.label: Feeds & Sitemaps
config.note: Enable CDN for assets linked within feeds. It's recommended to keep these disabled unless you have a specific need.

config.name: enableSitemap
config.label: Sitemap
config.note: Rewrites asset URLs (e.g., image sitemaps) within the sitemap.xml. This will NOT rewrite the main page URLs, which is important for SEO.

config.name: enableJsonFeed
config.label: JSON Feed
config.note: Rewrites image and asset URLs within the feed.json file.

config.name: enableXmlFeed
config.label: RSS Feed
config.note: Rewrites image and asset URLs within the feed.xml file.
